alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Wayne; White (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 8:29PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern White, Wayne and northern Hamilton Counties through 915 PM CDT... At 827 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Helm to near Bluford to 10 miles west of Mcleansboro. Movement was east at 50 mph. Trained spotters reported 40 to 45 mph winds and pea size hail as this line moved through Mount Vernon. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Cisne around 840 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Fairfield. This includes Interstate 64 in Illinois between Mile Markers 92 and 121. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central Illinois.
